DOC.brief_summary: The number cardiac angiography percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) increase steadily recent year . This result increase incidence contrast-induced acute kidney injury ( CIAKI ) . Major risk factor CIAKI include old age , diabetes mellitus ( DM ) , chronic kidney disease ( CKD ) , concurrent use nephrotoxic drug , hemodynamic instability , etc . Importantly , DM appear act risk multiplier , mean patient CKD amplifies risk CIAKI . The aim multicenter prospective , randomize , control study evaluate whether statin treatment perioperative period would reduce risk CIAKI high-risk population patient type 2 diabetes mellitus ( T2DM ) CKD undergo coronary angiography noncoronary angiography , evaluate influence potential benefit short-term outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Rosuvastatin Prevent Contrast Induced Acute Kidney Injury Patients With Diabetes
